title: Accessibility statement
heading: Accessibility statement for the DWP login and identification service

service-summary.p-1: This accessibility statement applies to the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) login and identification service. This service allows citizens to access other DWP online services by:
service-summary.li-2: using HM Revenue & Customs Identity Verification (HMRC IV) to prove their identity

accessibility-summary.p-1: This website is run by DWP. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. For example, that means you should be able to:
accessibility-summary.li-1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
accessibility-summary.li-2: zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
accessibility-summary.li-3: navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
accessibility-summary.li-4: navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
accessibility-summary.li-5: listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
accessibility-summary.p-2: We have also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.

reporting.heading: Reporting accessibility problems with this website

p-1.text-1: We’re always looking to improve the accessibility of this website. If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we’re not meeting accessibility requirements, contact:

The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’). If you’re not happy with how we respond to your complaint,
p-1.link-text-1: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS)

contact-phone.heading: Contacting us by phone or visiting us in person
contact-phone.p-1: We provide a text relay service for people who are D/deaf, hearing impaired or have a speech impediment.
contact-phone.p-2: Our offices have audio induction loops, or if you contact us before your visit we can arrange a British Sign Language (BSL) interpreter.

technical-info.p-1: DWP is committed to making its website accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
